medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in his usual state of health until 7 days before transfer, when he developed a nonproductive cough and intermittent fever up to 38.2Â°C. Over the next 4 days, these symptoms persisted and were accompanied by malaise, mild anorexia, weakness, and exertional dyspnea. On the morning before transfer, dyspnea occurred with minimal exertion, and he presented to a local urgent care clinic.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hyperlipidemia, hypertension, benign prostatic hypertrophy, and hemorrhoids. Previous tonsillectomy. Outpatient medications included atorvastatin, hydrochlorothiazide, inhaled fluticasone, and hydrocortisone rectal cream.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of myocardial infarction at 61 years; two paternal uncles died of coronary artery disease, one in the fifth decade and one in the sixth decade.
medical_history.social_history: Does not smoke tobacco, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs. Has a long-term male partner but is not sexually active. Works at a university. Traveled to Washington, D.C. one week prior to presentation.
